page.title: 03BIOGRAPHY
page.content: {An important person living here was the Lord Mayor of Gateshead, Mrs. Robson who now lives at Kibblesworth. The mayor is the first citizen and presides over council meetings. Mrs. Robson was the first lady Mayor for 22 years and is addressed as Madam Mayor by the councillors. She wears a special robe and hat and a mayoral chain. She is helped by the mace bearer who carries the mace on official visits. It is made of silver plated with gold and is decorated with emblems connected with Gateshead. She also opens new buildings, visits the sick and meets old people, visits schools and meets and entertains many important people visiting Gateshead. She enjoys meeting a wide variety of people.
